revised_title: Evolution of Sedimentary Basins on the Northwest Australian Continental Margin
tldr: This article discusses the geological evolution of the northwest Australian continental margin from the late Palaeozoic to the Upper Cretaceous. It examines the tectonic processes that led to the formation of sedimentary basins and their relationship to hydrocarbon occurrences. The study covers the major geological elements, structural cross-sections, and the regional isopachs of the Jurassic, Cretaceous, and Tertiary within the main basinal areas.
